intro: Licania rondonii, commonly known as the Rondonia licania, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to the Amazon rainforest, specifically found in Brazil and Peru. The plant is characterized by its large, palmate leaves and clusters of small, white flowers. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and plays a role in the ecological dynamics of the rainforest. Due to its restricted habitat, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
